Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history to win Game 1
Freddie Freeman homered in Game 2, making him just the seventh Dodger to homer in consecutive World Series games
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers offense is as big a reason as any that they are two wins away from a championship
The Dodgers are just the eighth team with consecutive games in the same World Series with five or more extra-base hits
Jack Flaherty allowed just two runs in his 5⅓ innings in Game 1 and Yoshinobu Yamamoto even stingier with only a Juan Soto solo home run in his 6⅓ innings in Game 2
Post-Match Reflections: Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history to win Game 1
Freddie Freeman also homered in Game 2
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers got home runs from Teoscar Hernández and Tommy Edman in Game 2
The other guys in LA’s lineup through two games are hitting.225/.256/.500 with six extra-base hits, four RBI, and five runs scored

Yankees outside of the big three are hitting just.174/.269/.196 with one extra-base hit (a Gleyber Torres double), one run scored (by Jazz Chisholm Jr., after stealing two bases off Blake Treinen), and one RBI (by Anthony Volpe, on a groundout) through two games
